title: Creative Operations Manager - WPP@Unilever
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
Creative operations play a crucial role in enhancing the efficiency of creative teams by introducing structure, process, and metrics to the creative workflow. Ogilvy Singapore is in search of a dynamic and energetic candidate for the position of Creative Operations Manager (COM). The ideal candidate should thrive in an interactive environment, possess exceptional attention to detail, and have a passion for addressing day-to-day challenges in a dynamic, fast-paced setting.
As the Creative Operations Manager, you will report to the business head and you will be instrumental in facilitating creative operations. You will also be contributing to the continuous optimization of a high-impact creative operations framework. Your focus will be on enabling low-touch and multi-speed workflows to deliver best-in-class creative solutions more efficiently.
There are three main areas in which the COM will implement this framework:
What You’ll Do 

Capacity & Capability Management:


Real-time and data-informed approach to capacity and utilization management.
Facilitate weekly resource planning meetings with project owners.
Strategic planning, allocation, and management of Creative talent based on brief requirements and budget allocations.
Proactively work with project owners to shift and reprioritize projects.
Enable cross-border resource planning and sharing.
Strategic load-balancing for work/life balance and timely utilization of leave entitlements.
Minimize freelance engagement and reduce freelance spend.


Process & Workflow Management:


Facilitate the agency core process – Think, Create, Realize & Optimize.
Manage creative workflows and processes for efficient and speedy outcomes.
Facilitate brief review and validation process.
Manage creative scope-creep and additional deliverables.
Include Production experts throughout the creative process.
Enable dynamic creative and smart production workflows.
Ensure Quality Assurance (QA) process for on-brand deliverables.
Management of client scoping system


Resource and Budget Management:


Enforce timesheet completion and compliance.
Participate in the scoping process and recommend effective resource structures.
Comprehend project revenue forecasts and margin targets.
Assist/facilitate with freelancer paperwork and 'pre-approval' investment process.
Real-time management and reconciliation of project-level creative budgets.
Generate and distribute weekly creative utilization analysis.

What You’ll Need  

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills.
Resourceful, collaborative, responsive, and accountable.
Experience with workflow and tools (e.g., Smartsheet, Resource Management Tool).
Process-driven with flexibility.
Ability to multitask, set priorities, and be resourceful in a fast-paced environment.
Innovative thinking to improve processes and workflows.
Understanding of integrated, omnichannel campaign development processes.
Super organized and deadline-focused.
Financially aware and savvy.
Understanding of Production, Art Buying, Studio, and Craft processes.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office365, Word, PowerPoint, Excel; Google Docs; Adobe Creative Cloud is a plus; Experience with Mac operating system.

How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
